title: Antipasto Salad Recipe
description: This antipasto salad is dressed in vinaigrette with 2 kinds of salami, 2 kinds of cheese, artichoke hearts, olives, tomatoes, and roasted red peppers.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Global Cuisines European Italian Salads Antipasto Salad 4.8 (57) 43 Reviews 19 Photos This antipasto salad is colorful and easy to make. After searching for a recipe for an antipasto salad that I had envisioned in my head, I gave up and just decided to create one myself. I made this dish for a party, and everyone couldn't stop talking about it. The ratio of meat, cheese, and veggies can be adjusted to taste. Submitted by Katie Greco Updated on April 10, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 19 19 19 19 Prep Time: 30 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 10 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 10 servings 8 ounces Genoa salami, cut into bite-sized pieces 8 ounces sopressata or other hard salami, cut into bite-sized pieces 8 ounces sharp provolone cheese, cut into bite-sized pieces 8 ounces fresh mozzarella cheese, cut into bite-sized pieces 2 large tomatoes, cut into bite-sized pieces 1 (14 ounce) can artichokes, drained and cut into bite-sized pieces ½ (12-ounce jar) roasted red peppers ½ cup pitted and coarsely chopped Kalamata olives ¼ cup pitted and chopped green olives 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil 3 tablespoons red wine vinegar freshly ground black pepper to taste ¼ cup fresh basil leaves Directions Combine Genoa and soppressata salamis, provolone, mozzarella, tomatoes, and artichokes in a bowl. Slice roasted red peppers and add them to the bowl with about 3 tablespoons juice from the red pepper jar. Mix in chopped olives. Drizzle olive oil over salami mixture, followed by red wine vinegar. Season with pepper. Mix thoroughly. Store in the refrigerator until serving time. Before serving, tear fresh basil leaves into bite-sized pieces and fold them into salad. Cook’s Note You can use marinated artichoke hearts instead of water-packed ones if you prefer. I Made It Print 154 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. Add Your Photo Photos of Antipasto Salad 01 of 19 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 19 Photo by  Kat Jurewicz 02/08/2021 03 of 19 Photo by  Joanie Harshaw 01/24/2020 04 of 19 Photo by  Red Wings Hockey 08/06/2019 05 of 19 Photo by  desert_kat 02/05/2019 It turned out great! Two small changes: I left out the artichoke hearts and used a tablespoon of balsamic honey dressing instead of the red wine vinegar. It really was yummy! 06 of 19 Photo by  desert_kat 02/05/2019 It turned out great! Two small changes: I left out the artichoke hearts and used a tablespoon of balsamic honey dressing instead of the red wine vinegar. It really was yummy! 07 of 19 Photo by  chris 01/26/2019 08 of 19 Photo by  Mike Wallace 11/16/2018 09 of 19 Photo by  Amanda Potter 08/17/2017 VERY hearty. Can only eat a small portion at one sitting. Does not last well as leftovers. 10 of 19 Photo by  Susan 08/05/2017 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Tortellini Salad 174 Ratings Peach and Tomato Caprese Salad 24 Ratings Orzo Tomato Artichoke Salad 19 Ratings Chickpea-on-Chickpea Pasta Salad Summer Corn Salad with Asparagus 37 Ratings Pasta Fredda 29 Ratings Easy Mediterranean Orzo Salad 1 Rating Greek Horiatiki Salad 29 Ratings Caprese Salad with Balsamic Reduction 196 Ratings Grilled Corn and Edamame Succotash Salad 4 Ratings Caprese Pasta with Thai Basil 4 Ratings Zesty Southern Pasta and Bean Salad 74 Ratings Mandarin Chicken Pasta Salad 356 Ratings Elote Salad 33 Ratings Mint Corn Salad 7 Ratings Strawberry Fluff 98 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Katie Greco
instructions: Combine Genoa and soppressata salamis, provolone, mozzarella, tomatoes, and artichokes in a bowl. Slice roasted red peppers and add them to the bowl with about 3 tablespoons juice from the red pepper jar. Mix in chopped olives.;Drizzle olive oil over salami mixture, followed by red wine vinegar. Season with pepper. Mix thoroughly. Store in the refrigerator until serving time.;Before serving, tear fresh basil leaves into bite-sized pieces and fold them into salad.
